details:
* [CVE-2017-6298](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6298)
Null Pointer Deref / calloc return value not checked
* [CVE-2017-6299](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6299)
Infinite Loop / DoS in the TNEFFillMapi function in lib/ytnef.c
* [CVE-2017-6300](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6300)
Buffer Overflow in version field in lib/tnef-types.h
* [CVE-2017-6301](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6301)
Out of Bounds Reads
* [CVE-2017-6302](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6302)
Integer Overflow
* [CVE-2017-6303](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6303)
Invalid Write and Integer Overflow
* [CVE-2017-6304](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6304)
Out of Bounds read
* [CVE-2017-6305](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6305)
Out of Bounds read and write
* [CVE-2017-6801](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6801)
Out-of-bounds access with fields of Size 0 in TNEFParse() in libytnef
* [CVE-2017-6802](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-6802)
Heap-based buffer over-read on incoming Compressed RTF Streams,
 related to DecompressRTF() in libytnef


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
1.5-4+deb7u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your libytnef packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
